newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Nail in talks to take GFSA stake - sources.
newsitem.headline: Nail in talks to take GFSA stake - sources.

text.p: Black empowerment business group New Africa Investment Ltd is in talks to take an interest in Gold Fields of South Africa Ltd, industry sources said on Wednesday.
Cautionary announcements would be placed in Thursday's newspapers advising shareholders that certain negotiations were in progress, the sources said.

Gold Fields' future has been the subject of much speculation recently with local analysts wondering which suitor would successfully snatch a stake in the group of which Rembrandt holds a 40 percent chunk.

Nail had been seen as a potential biddder for a stake in rival mining house JCI Ltd, but that deal was finally clinched by another black empowerment consortium African Mining Group led by Capital Alliance Holdings Ltd.
In January Gold Fields said it had been speaking to Nail, but not about taking a stake in the group's mining operations.
The group also has interests in industrial and property companies.
